title: Attorney's bond
context: ยง431:4-411 Attorney&rsquo;s bond. (a) Concurrently with the filing of the declaration provided for in section 431:4-409, the attorney of a domestic reciprocal shall file with the commissioner a bond in favor of this State. The bond shall be executed by the attorney and by an authorized corporate surety, and shall be subject to the commissioner&rsquo;s approval. (b) The bond shall be in the sum of $25,000 conditioned that the attorney will faithfully account, before a notary public, in a sworn affidavit, for all moneys and other property of the insurer coming into the attorney&rsquo;s hands, and that the attorney will not withdraw or appropriate for the attorney&rsquo;s own use from the funds of the insurer any moneys or property to which the attorney is not entitled under the power of attorney. &copy; The bond shall provide that it is not subject to cancellation unless sixty days&rsquo; advance notice in writing of intent to cancel is given to both the attorney and the commissioner.
